text: A feather burned halfway through lies beside an extinguished torch — same pigment as Bifang’s plumage.
The only witness insists "multiple shadows" slid away from the altar after the scream.
Broken feathers and claw marks litter the ground, but every direction is different — as if multiple attackers collided.
Blue phosphorescence remains on the altarpiece.
A feather burned halfway through lies beside an extinguished torch — same pigment as Bifang’s plumage.
Charred floor tiles form spiral scorch marks, consistent with fire-element flight bursts.
Smoke residue reveals traces of copper and oil, suggesting controlled ignition rather than wildfire.
